ca.mcgill.ecse211.tools

Class SubMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.tools.SubMenu
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalibrationMenu, DemosMenu, MainMenu, TestsMenu

    public class SubMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a menu that allows the user to add actions/methods as items to the list displayed on the EV3.

    This menu system can be extended by first instantiating a SubMenu object, then performing addItem() on this object to add menu items. These menu items are always objects that implement the MenuAction and MenuCommand interfaces.

    Author:
    Ryan Au auryan898@gmail.com

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public void addItem(java.lang.String title,
           MenuAction action)
        Adds a new user-defined action to the menu, given the title of the menu option, and an instance of the MenuAction interface.
        Parameters:
        title - name of menu item
        action - MenuAction instance to use when executing

      • addItem

        public void addItem(java.lang.String title,
           MenuCommand command)
        Adds a new user-defined action to the menu, given the title of the menu option, and an instance of the MenuCommand interface. The difference between this using MenuAction is that this will run a UI that prints the value of getStatus(), binds the left and right buttons of the EV3 call setStatus(-1) and setStatus(+1), and binds the down button to call action() of the MenuCommand instance.
        Parameters:
        title - name of menu item displayed
        command - MenuCommand interface to utilize

      • select

        public boolean select()
        Activate the menu, displaying it to the robot's TextLCD and becoming interactive. A menu item can be chosen, then the user can exit back into the previous menu.
        Returns:
        true indicates this menu exited properly, false if the menu fails
